intro: Tanacetum eriobasis subsp. tricholepis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tansy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with finely divided, grass-like leaves and yellow button-like flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, stream banks, and woodland edges. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in herbal medicine, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
